newsitem.title: POLAND: Budimex unit to build MAN plant.
newsitem.headline: Budimex unit to build MAN plant.

text.p: A subsidary of Polish Budimex builder Budimex-Poznan has signed a contract with MAN Nutzfahrzeuge, a unit of Germany's MAN AG, to construct a bus assembly plant in Poland, Budimex-Poznan's head said.
Wojciech Wierzbicki told Reuters that under the agreement, signed on Monday, his company would build the factory's production site and its infrastructure by October 17, 1997.
"We will provide all construction and building works as well as installations, except for installing machines for production," Wierzbicki told Reuters.
He said the value of the contract with MAN was a part of the total cost of the factory's construction of 23 million marks, but declined to disclose the exact value of the deal.
The construction of MAN's factory, which will initially assemble 120 buses annually and employ 250 people, was launched on Tuesday, PAP news agency reported.
The output of the plant, located near the western city of Poznan, would eventually be expanded to 600 buses annuaLly and the workforce to 900, PAP said.
Wierzbicki said Budimex had a controlling stake in Budimex-Poznan. The municipality of Poznan and several individual investors held the remaining shares, he said.
PAP has quoted MAN's management board member Franz Breun as saying that his company counted on orders from Polish cities, which needed to replace half of municipal transport buses.
